supportingMedia.value:
To be exposed to this vulnerability BGP needs to be configured as in the following example, but no further options need to be enabled:

  [ protocols bgp group <group> neighbor ... ]

configuration.value:
To be exposed to this vulnerability BGP needs to be configured as in the following example, but no further options need to be enabled:

  [ protocols bgp group <group> neighbor ... ]

supportingMedia.value: Juniper SIRT is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this vulnerability.

exploit.value: Juniper SIRT is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this vulnerability.

description.value: CWE-1286 Improper Validation of Syntactic Correctness of Input

supportingMedia.value:
The following software releases have been updated to resolve this specific issue:

Junos OS: 20.4R3-S9, 21.2R3-S7, 21.3R3-S5, 21.4R3-S5, 22.1R3-S4, 22.2R3-S3, 22.3R3-S1, 22.4R3, 23.2R1-S2, 23.2R2, 23.4R1, and all subsequent releases;

Junos OS Evolved: 20.4R3-S9-EVO, 21.2R3-S7-EVO, 21.3R3-S5-EVO, 21.4R3-S5-EVO, 22.1R3-S4-EVO, 22.2R3-S3-EVO, 22.3R3-S1-EVO, 22.4R3-EVO, 23.2R1-S2-EVO, 23.2R2-EVO, 23.4R1-EVO, and all subsequent releases.

work_around.value: There are no known workarounds for this issue.
